headline: Why Schlumberger Stock Slumped on Friday
summary: A promise to continue returning billions of dollars to shareholders couldn't make up for a lackluster first quarter from Schlumberger (NYSE: SLB) on Friday.  The former metric slid by 3% to $8.49 billion for the oilfield services company, while non-GAAP (adjusted) net income saw a 9% tumble to $988 million ($0.72 in per-share terms).  Prognosticators covering Schlumberger were collectively projecting $8.64 billion for revenue, and adjusted net income of $0.74 per share.

headline: Schlumberger CEO Warns Macro Uncertainty May Hit Demand, Commits To Protect Margins And Cash Flow
summary: Schlumberger N.V. (NYSE:SLB) shares are trading lower on Friday after the company reported worse-than-expected first-quarter 2025 results. Revenue declined 3% year over year to $8.49 billion, missing estimates of $8.59 billion. Adjusted EPS slid 4% to 72 cents, missing the consensus of 74 cents. North America revenue rose 8% YoY to $1.72B, driven by digital, subsea, and data center sales, but fell 2% sequentially on lower drilling activity. International revenue declined 5% year-over-year to $6.

headline: SLB Earnings Miss Estimates. The Stock Is Falling.
summary: The company’s fortunes are closely tied to prices of oil and gas, and they haven’t provided much help.

headline: AbbVie, Schlumberger, Colgate-Palmolive: Trending tickers
summary: Here are some stocks on the move on April 25. AbbVie (ABBV) raised its 2025 profit forecast, citing the strength of some of the newer drugs in its immunology portfolio. Schlumberger (SLB) reported first quarter earnings that fell short of estimates. Colgate-Palmolive (CL) cut its full-year earnings outlook, citing tariff impacts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Schlumberger (SLB) Lags Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Schlumberger (SLB) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -2.70% and 1.27%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Schlumberger: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Schlumberger NV (SLB) on Friday reported first-quarter profit of $797 million. On a per-share basis, the The Hague, Netherlands-based company said it had net income of 58 cents. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs and costs related to mergers and acquisitions, were 72 cents per share.
